pullRequest.body:
We define the vertical strips that are needed for proving Eisenstein series are modular forms #10377 . We also add the definition of sqrt{-1} as an elements of the upper half plane. Note that this is no longer needed for the modular forms PRs but its good to have.

Sorry about the typo in the PR name, its not my day!

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Since the vertical-strip stuff doesn't use the metric any more, it probably shouldn't be in `UpperHalfPlane/Metric.lean`.

> Since the vertical-strip stuff doesn't use the metric any more, it probably shouldn't be in `UpperHalfPlane/Metric.lean`.

Good point, I'm not quite sure where to place it, I guess it could go into topology?

I think for consistency with mathlib's naming conventions, `strip_mem_iff` should probably be `mem_verticalStrip_iff`, and similarly `subset_verticalStrip_of_isCompact` for the other one. Otherwise looks good, I'd be happy to recommend this for merging modulo that change.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Thanks!

Looks straightforward; I just have three minor comments. Thanks for your contribution!

LGTM, thanks!

maintainer merge

How about the following?
```suggestion
/-- `i := âˆš-1` as an element on the upper half plane. -/

Can you elaborate more in the docstring what the vertical strip is? To me, this is not standard notation. (Repeating the definition is fine to me.) 

The definition itself and the later lemma are clear; to me, the docstring being clear is valuable both for viewing the generated documentation and hovering over the definition.
I wonder if switching u and v in these lines would be clearer. (This is a micro-nit; I don't care strongly about this.)
I'm not sure I understand, you mean just swap what u and v are defined as?
Yes, you did what I meant :-)
If you care, you could also switch these two lines. (But this is really nano-comment territory.)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Complex/UpperHalfPlane): add vertical strips

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - Eisenstein series uniform convergence

nodes.body: Since the vertical-strip stuff doesn't use the metric any more, it probably shouldn't be in `UpperHalfPlane/Metric.lean`.

> Since the vertical-strip stuff doesn't use the metric any more, it probably shouldn't be in `UpperHalfPlane/Metric.lean`.

Good point, I'm not quite sure where to place it, I guess it could go into topology?
Looks straightforward; I just have three minor comments. Thanks for your contribution!

I think for consistency with mathlib's naming conventions, `strip_mem_iff` should probably be `mem_verticalStrip_iff`, and similarly `subset_verticalStrip_of_isCompact` for the other one. Otherwise looks good, I'd be happy to recommend this for merging modulo that change.

LGTM, thanks!
